intro: Aeollanthus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leafed aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often violet or purple in color and attract pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
